View page on sitePage historySuggested Edits 0
The disputes API helps you find out about and act on all of your open disputes within the required timeframe. Together with our webhooks, which help you keep track of each status change of a dispute, you will be well equipped to manage your way around disputes. With the disputes API, you can: - [View a list of disputes](doc:disputes-api#section-get-a-list-of-disputes) - [View information about a specific dispute](doc:disputes-api#section-get-details-about-a-dispute) - [Provide evidence](doc:disputes-api#section-provide-evidence) - [Accept a dispute](doc:disputes-api#section-accept-a-dispute) 
If you wish to simulate a dispute for testing purposes, you can do so in the sandbox environment. Simply create a payment with one of the test cards and specify the amount [as documented here](testing#section-chargebacks). 
 
Each dispute has an associated status that describes which stage of the dispute process it has reached. If you would like to be notified when the status of a dispute changes, you can use our [webhooks](doc:broadcast-webhook-management) feature.  
x    
Add Row Add Col
`evidence_required` 
A dispute has started. The amount is charged back from your account. 
`dispute_evidence_required` <span class="table-info">View a [dispute evidence required webhook example](doc:dispute_evidence_required)</span> 
`resolved` 
The payment was previously refunded, we automatically represent without debiting you. 
`dispute_resolved` <span class="table-info">View a [dispute resolved webhook example](doc:dispute_resolved)</span> 
`canceled` 
The dispute has been canceled by issuing bank. 
`dispute_canceled` <span class="table-info">View a [dispute canceled webhook example](doc:dispute_canceled)</span> 
`evidence_under_review` 
You have provided the required evidence and we have forwarded this to the card network. 
There is no equivalent webhook because your action triggered the status change. 
`lost` 
You have lost the dispute. This has no further financial implication. 
`dispute_lost` <span class="table-info">View a [dispute lost webhook example](doc:dispute_lost)</span> 
`won` 
You have won the dispute. Your account is credited back with the amount you were previously debited. 
`dispute_won` <span class="table-info">View a [dispute won webhook example](doc:dispute_won)</span> 
`expired` 
You have failed to provide evidence within the required timeframe. 
`dispute_expired` <span class="table-info">View a [dispute expired webhook example](doc:dispute_expired)</span> 
`accepted` 
You have accepted the dispute. This has no financial implications. 
There is no equivalent webhook because your action triggered the status change. 
 
## Header and path parameters You should use the following header parameters for all dispute-related requests. 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`Authorization` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`secret key`* 
`Content-Type` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`application/json` 
*For authorization, use the valid `secret key` of your Checkout.com account. This will authorize you to use the API for your specific business. You can find this in [The Hub](https://hub.checkout.com/). Additionally, some of the requests associated with disputes include a path as described below. 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`dispute_id` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The dispute identifier. It is prefixed by `dsp_`. 
 
You can use our API to view a list of disputes or to retrieve information about a specific dispute. ## Get a list of disputes Retrieve a list of disputes against your business. These will be returned in chronological order, showing latest updates first. You can use the additional parameters to skip or limit results. ### The request Dispute queries are created using a GET request. Use the details below to set up your request. #### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://api.checkout.com/disputes/</p></pre> #### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/</p></pre> #### Additional parameters You can use the following additional parameters to specify results. Simply add them to the end of the endpoint URL. 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`limit` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
The number of items to return. 
`skip` <span class="field-type">Integer</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set. 
`from` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Filter by 'last update' after the provided value (formatted in ISO 8601). Do not specify the exact time here, as it will return an error. 
`to` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Filter by 'last update' before the provided value (formatted in ISO 8601). Do not specify the exact time here, as it will return an error. 
`statuses` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
One or more comma separated statuses, e.g. `evidence_required` and `evidence_under_review`. 
#### Request example 
cURL
rename · delete
 
1
curl https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/?limit=10&skip=10&from=2017-08-12&to=2017-08-13
2
  -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
  -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
  -X GET
Import from Gist

## Get details about a dispute Retrieve all information information regarding a specific dispute. ### The request Dispute queries are created using a GET request. Use the details below to set up your request. #### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://api.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}</p></pre> #### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}</p></pre> #### Request example 
cURL
rename · delete
 
1
curl https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/dsp_BD69ED775Z1E5DF940D3
2
    -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
    -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
    -X GET
Import from Gist
### The response If a dispute object returns, then your request was successful. It will look something like this:

Import from Gist
 
In order to win a dispute, you will need to provide relevant evidence to your case. This could be the invoice, the proof of delivery, or even customer communication regarding the payment that was charged back. You can use our API to upload evidence, review this evidence, and submit it when you're ready. ## Provide evidence Add supporting evidence to a dispute. Note that this only attaches the evidence to the dispute, it does not send it to us yet – once ready, you will need to [submit it](doc:disputes-api#section-submit-evidence).  
The type of evidence we recommend submitting depends on the reason for the dispute. [Click here](doc:disputes#section-dispute-reasons-and-recommended-evidence) to find out more. 
 
If you wish to submit files as evidence, you will first need to upload them using the [file uploader API](doc:file-uploader). This will give you a file `id` (prefixed by `file_`) which you can then use in your request. 
### The request A request to provide evidence is created using a PUT request. Use the details below to set up your request. #### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="put-tag">PUT</span>https://api.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/evidence</p></pre> #### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="put-tag">PUT</span>https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/evidence</p></pre> 
If you run this request more than once, you will overwrite the previous request. 
#### Additional parameters You must provide at least one of the evidence types listed below in the body of your request. Each of the following can be provided as either a text string and/or or a file ID previously uploaded. Simply specify it in your request as {evidence_type}_file or {evidence_type}_text (e.g. proof_of_delivery_or_service_file). 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`proof_of_delivery_or_service` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Your proof of delivery or service. Please make sure to add the date of delivery here too. 
`invoice_or_receipt` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
The invoice or receipt of the payment. 
`invoice_showing_distinct_transactions` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Your invoice showing two distinct transactions. This is relevant in case the cardholder claims a payment was charged twice (duplicate). 
`customer_communication` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Case relevant customer communication, that proves that the payment was valid. 
`refund_or_cancellation_policy` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Your refund or cancellation policy. If it is a large document, a screenshot of the relevant part will suffice. 
`recurring_transaction_agreement` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Your recurring transaction agreement. If it is a large document, a screenshot of the relevant part will suffice. 
`additional_evidence` <span class="field-type">String</span> <span class="optional-def">Optional</span> 
Additional evidence supporting your case that does not fall under the above categories. 
#### Request example 
cURL
rename · delete
 
1
curl https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/dsp_BD69ED775Z1E5DF940D3
2
    -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
    -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
    -X PUT
5
    -d {
6
      "proof_of_delivery_or_service_file": "file_bd69ed775z1e5df940d3",
7
      "proof_of_delivery_or_service_text": "a brief description of the file",
8
      "customer_communication_file": "file_iw68oe795o1e5xc940s9"
9
}
Import from Gist
### The response If you receive a `2XX` response, then your dispute evidence was successfully provided. You can submit it when ready. If you receive a `4XX` response, then something went wrong. Check the error code to find out why.

## Retrieve evidence Use this API to view a list of the evidence that was provided for a specific dispute. ### The request Evidence can be retrieved using a GET request. Use the details below to set up your request. #### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://api.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/evidence</p></pre> #### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/evidence</p></pre> #### Request example 
cURL
rename · delete
 
1
curl https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/dsp_BD69ED775Z1E5DF940D3/evidence
2
    -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
    -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
    -X GET
Import from Gist
### The response #### Response example If you receive a response containing a dispute object, then your request was successful. It will look something like this: 
JSON

2

3

4
  "customer_communication": "file_iw68oe795o1e5xc940s9"
5

Import from Gist
## Submit evidence With this final request, you can submit the evidence that you have previously provided.  
You will not be able to amend your evidence once you have submitted it. Make sure you have provided all the relevant information before using this request. 
### The request Evidence submissions are created using a POST request. Use the details below to set up your request. #### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/evidence</p></pre> #### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/evidence</p></pre> #### Request example 
cURL
rename · delete
 
1
curl https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/dsp_BD69ED775Z1E5DF940D3/evidence
2
    -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
    -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
    -X POST
Import from Gist
### The response If you receive a `2XX` response, then your dispute evidence was successfully submitted. We will pass it on to the card scheme. If you receive a `4XX` response, then something went wrong. Check the error code to find out why.

## Accept a dispute If a dispute is legitimate, you can choose to accept it. This will close it for you and remove it from your list of open disputes. There are no further financial implications. ### The request Disputes are accepted via a POST request. Use the details below to set up your request. #### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/accept</p></pre> #### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/{dispute_id}/accept</p></pre> #### Request example 
cURL
rename · delete
 
1
curl https://api.sandbox.checkout.com/disputes/dsp_BD69ED775Z1E5DF940D3/accept
2
    -H "Authorization: sk_test_55aedccc-7f53-4ccc-b0a6-d943decc3c31"
3
    -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8"
4
    -X POST
Import from Gist
### The response If you receive a `2XX` response, then you successfully accepted the dispute. If you receive a `4XX` response, then something went wrong. Check the error code to find out why.
